verses.kjv: He cried also in mine ears with a loud voice, saying, Cause them that have charge over the city to draw near, even every man with his destroying weapon in his hand.
verses.ct: Then he shouted in my ears with a loud voice, "Summon the guards appointed over the city, each one carrying his weapon of destruction!"

verses.kjv: And, behold, six men came from the way of the higher gate, which lieth toward the north, and every man a slaughter weapon in his hand; and one man among them was clothed with linen, with a writer’s inkhorn by his side: and they went in, and stood beside the brasen altar.
verses.ct: I looked, and 6 men came from the direction of the upper gate that faces north, each holding a deadly weapon. Among them was a man dressed in linen with a scribe's writing kit at his side. They entered and stood beside the bronze altar.

verses.kjv: And the glory of the God of Israel was gone up from the cherub, whereupon he was, to the threshold of the house. And he called to the man clothed with linen, which had the writer’s inkhorn by his side;
verses.ct: Now the glory of the God of Israel had risen from the cherub where it had been resting and moved to the threshold of the temple. He called out to the man dressed in linen who had the writing kit at his side.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto him, Go through the midst of the city, through the midst of Jerusalem, and set a mark upon the foreheads of the men that sigh and that cry for all the abominations that be done in the midst thereof.
verses.ct: The LORD told him, "Go through the middle of the city, through all of Jerusalem, and put a mark on the foreheads of everyone who grieves and mourns over all the disgusting things being done there."

verses.kjv: And to the others he said in mine hearing, Go ye after him through the city, and smite: let not your eye spare, neither have ye pity:
verses.ct: To the others he said within my hearing, "Follow behind him through the city and strike people down. Show no mercy and have no pity.

verses.kjv: Slay utterly old and young, both maids, and little children, and women: but come not near any man upon whom is the mark; and begin at my sanctuary. Then they began at the ancient men which were before the house.
verses.ct: Kill them all — old men, young men, young women, children, and women. But don't touch anyone who has the mark on them. Start at my sanctuary." So they began with the elders who were in front of the temple.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Defile the house, and fill the courts with the slain: go ye forth. And they went forth, and slew in the city.
verses.ct: Then he told them, "Make the temple unclean and fill the courtyards with the dead. Go!" So they went out and began killing throughout the city.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, while they were slaying them, and I was left, that I fell upon my face, and cried, and said, Ah Lord GOD! wilt thou destroy all the residue of Israel in thy pouring out of thy fury upon Jerusalem?
verses.ct: While they were carrying out the slaughter and I was left alone, I dropped to the ground and cried out, "Oh, Lord GOD! Are you going to destroy everyone left in Israel as you pour out your rage on Jerusalem?"

verses.kjv: Then said he unto me, The iniquity of the house of Israel and Judah is exceeding great, and the land is full of blood, and the city full of perverseness: for they say, The LORD hath forsaken the earth, and the LORD seeth not.
verses.ct: He answered me, "The sin of the people of Israel and Judah is incredibly great. The land is drenched in bloodshed, and the city is full of corruption. They keep saying, 'The LORD has abandoned the land,' and 'The LORD doesn't see what we do.'"

verses.kjv: And as for me also, mine eye shall not spare, neither will I have pity, but I will recompense their way upon their head.
verses.ct: "So I will not show mercy, and I will have no pity. I will bring the consequences of their actions down on their own heads."

verses.kjv: And, behold, the man clothed with linen, which had the inkhorn by his side, reported the matter, saying, I have done as thou hast commanded me.
verses.ct: Then the man dressed in linen with the writing kit at his side came back and reported, "I have carried out everything you commanded me to do."
